001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.annotations;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.base.ComponentType;
004import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
005import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
006import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
007import java.lang.annotation.Target;
008
009/**
010 * Indicates that the annotated field should be used as a filterable column or property
011 * in a table. When this annotation is present, the table logic will apply filtering
012 * logic based on the associated {@link #type()} and {@link #componentType()}.
013 *
014 * <p>Typical usage involves annotating a field within a row model class to specify
015 * which UI component (e.g., a text input, dropdown) is responsible for filtering
016 * that column. The table framework then retrieves this information at runtime
017 * (via reflection) to execute the proper filtering actions.
018 *
019 * <p>Where {@code InputComponentType} is an enum or class implementing
020 * {@link ComponentType}, and {@code TEXT_INPUT} is one of its constants.
021 *
022 * <p>The filtering mechanism is typically performed by a {@code TableFilter}
023 * implementation, which uses the specified component type to determine how
024 * to filter table rows based on user-provided input or predefined values.
025 *
026 * <p>This annotation is processed at runtime, and the table logic uses it
027 * alongside other annotations (e.g., {@link CellInsertion}) to build a complete
028 * picture of how each field in a row model should be handled.
029 *
030 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
031 */
032@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
033@Target(ElementType.FIELD)
034public @interface CellFilter {
035
036   /**
037    * Specifies the UI component type (e.g., an enum or class implementing
038    * {@link ComponentType}) that will handle filtering for this field.
039    *
040    * @return the class representing the component type.
041    */
042   Class<? extends ComponentType> type();
043
044   /**
045    * Defines the component type identifier (e.g., an enum constant or
046    * string) to distinguish which specific filter mechanism to apply.
047    *
048    * @return a string matching a known component type identifier.
049    */
050   String componentType();
051}
